intro: Psychotria mansoana, commonly known as the Brazilian Psychotria, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Psychotria mansoana is also noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its aesthetic appeal.
